definition: to advertise an entrance examination for an academic institution (old)
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: Article 26 Before recruiting and employing public servants, a public notice of entrance examination shall be issued.
sentences.chinese: 第二十六條錄用公務員，應當發佈招考公告。

sentences.english: Shenzhen to recruit civil servants , I am afraid that college is not acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 深圳要招考公務員，恐怕大專是不行的。

sentences.english: Word has it that even models have registered to take this flight attendant exam.
sentences.chinese: 據說連模特兒都來報考這次空服員招考。

sentences.english: Does Tongji University admit graduate student student that can discriminate against two normal school kind school by examination?
sentences.chinese: 同濟大學招考研究生會歧視二本師範類學校的學生麼？

definition: to enter oneself for an examination
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
to enroll new students/to get students
to add material to an exam/supplementary exam
horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
exam candidate/student whose name has been put forward for an exam
the exam area/the district where an exam takes place
student graduating in the current year/recent graduate
Examination Yuan, the qualification and appointment board under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan/exam board
